data.name: Basic Proof of Stake
data.description:
"Proof of Stake" is a consensus mechanism on a blockchain. Although there are many approaches to this, today we will look at a basic example for how we can find the next block validator.

In this example you will recieve the hash of the last block created and an array of validators with their total stake.

You are expected to return the **index of the next block validator**.

**The "hash" `mod` "total stake of all validators" will provide you with an integer that you can use to find your return value.**

*Examples*

INPUT - ("932ac377", [10,35,25,10,20])

EXPECTED OUTPUT - 0

INPUT - ("21e66e37e", [25,5,20,25,20,5])

EXPECTED OUTPUT - 4

INPUT - ("4170883f", [40,5,5,10,10,30])

EXPECTED OUTPUT - 3
